p: The mammalian respiratory tract is highly innervated with sensory fibers expressing TRPA1 and TRPV1. Sneezing occurs because of the activation of these sensory fibers (expressing TRPA1 and TRPV1) in the vagal sensory nerve terminals by noxious stimulants [ 4]. Signal transduction occurs by augmenting intracellular calcium concentrations and/or depolarizing membrane potentials [ 137, 138]. It was found that there is an overexpression of TRPV1 in the nasal mucosa and augmented substance P levels in nasal secretions in idiopathic rhinitis patients [ 139].
